courses.name: Basic Calculations
courses.description: This course is for helping you revisit basic mathematical concepts including addition and subtraction. Some lectures also walk you through basic concepts of geometry.

lectures.description: We start with addition and subtraction.

courses.name: Banking Services
courses.description: This course is to get you comfortable with simple banking services such as openning a bank account, withdrawing and depositing cash and so on.

lectures.description: Through an example, we walk through the exact steps necessary for opening up a bank account.
The advantage of having and using an ATM card

courses.name: IT Services
courses.description: This course aims to get you comfortable with the use of Information Technology, whether it be about sending an SMS, an email, or accessing any government facilities online.

lectures.description: Sending an SMS to a near and dear one, and how an SMS can help in times of emergency

lectures.lectureName: Setting up an email account and sending mail
lectures.description: This lecture walks you through the process of setting up an email account and eventually sending an email.
Here we familiarize you with the process of searching for information online.

courses.name: Miscellaneous Services
courses.description: This course provides information about getting a Driver's License, Voter ID card and other such important government documents.

lectures.description: Documents Reuqired, the online test and the final driving test
Along with emphasising upon the need to vote, the video also enlists the steps for getting a Voter ID card made.

laws.name: The Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act 1986
laws.description: The Act prohibits employment of children in certain specified hazardous occupations and processes and regulates the working conditions in others. The list of hazardous occupations and processes is progressively being expanded on the recommendation of Child Labour Technical Advisory Committee constituted under the Act.

schemes.name: 12th Five Year Plan (2012-2017) by the National Planning Commission
schemes.description: Focuses on vocational training and life skills education, mainstreaming gender into the policy and institutional framework, and extension of the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act to guarantee education of girls up to senior secondary level.

schemes.name: Five Year Strategic Plan (2011-2016) of the Ministry of Women and Child Development National Plan of Action for Children (2005)
schemes.description: Aims to considerably reduce anaemia among girls and aims to empower adolescent girls through nutrition, health care and life skills education. Objectives include promoting  physical, mental, emotional and reproductive health among  adolescents, sexuality and sexual responsibility, promotion of education including life skills, selfesteem and decision-making, protection from all forms of social, economic and sexual exploitation, violence and discrimination, and training opportunities to prepare them for sustainable livelihoods.

schemes.name: National Charter for Children
schemes.description: Includes specific on adolescents, and reflects the recognition by government of adolescents as a specific group with specific needs. It obliges the State and community to take all steps to provide the necessary education and skills to adolescent children to become economically productive citizens.

schemes.name: Draft National Youth Policy (2001)
schemes.description: Unlike the National Policy for the Empowerment of Women (2001), this adequately addresses gender inequality and provides a comprehensive view of adolescents and their concerns.
